session_info.name: MOYBA - Plenary Oral Session, Accelerator Technology

papers.title: The Future of Superconducting Technology for Accelerators
authors: Superconducting magnets and RF cavities are widely used in accelerators
and future accelerator projects heavily rely on this technology. There may be several questions on the future of the SC technology
concerning the feasibility of very high field dipoles (~15 T or more)
possible technology evolution(s) with new materials
and final sustainability of the technology in terms of helium procurement. The talk will cover a brief history/achievements and some interesting (future) developments
partly or fully answering these question.
